definition: to act as if/to treat sth as if it were
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: The above is only the power of the individual peep-hole view, thoughtful.
sentences.chinese: 以上只是个人的了一孔之见，权当抛砖引玉。

sentences.english: In the mother's arms is a cloth doll to replace her lost child.
sentences.chinese: 她妈妈怀中抱着一个布制的娃娃，权当她失去的孩子。

sentences.english: That girl he was hugging may well be just a friend.
sentences.chinese: 而父亲怀抱里的女孩就权当是朋友吧。

definition: no harm (in doing it)/One might as well./It won't hurt./no matter/it's no bother
to while the time away/amusement/pastime/recreation/to make sport of
to chant/see 梵唄|梵呗[fan4 bai4]
modal particle indicating indicating lack of enthusiasm/modal particle indicating that things should only or can only be done a certain way
to relieve boredom or melancholy/a diversion
at leisure/idle/to have nothing to do
lit. presenting the Buddha with borrowed flowers (idiom); fig. to win favor or influence using sb else's property/plagiarism
anyway/in any case/to come over from the enemy's side
